feat.name: Far Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Far Realm's magic has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell detect thoughts} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=e;t} of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=e;t} must be from the enchantment or transmutation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

item.name: Surgical Tools
entries: Skill at surgery enables a character to treat injuries more effectively. A surgeon can mend broken bones, patch up wounds and remove parts of a body.

entries.name: Components
entries: Surgical tools include a scalpel, a needle, thread, sanitizer, bandages, salves, splints, pincers, and a magnifying glass.

item.name: Rayn's Charm
entries: This charm was created by the rock gnome and avatar of Nyarlathotep Rayn. At dawn while in the possession of one of these charms, you roll a {@dice d20} to determine the effect of the item according to the following table. Any effects fade away at dusk.

entries.name: Curse
entries: After willingly obtainig this item, it will always reappear on your person should you ever lose it. A remove curse spell, or similar magic ends the curse.

entries.name: Rayn's Charm
rows: You can only speak in one random language.
You hear a booming echo from everything.
You hear etherial music playing in the background completly inaproriate to the situation.
You think it is unbelievebly hot.
You think it is unbelievebly cold.
Your vision gets a sepia tint.
{@dice 1d4} living herrings appear in your pockets.
Your touch ignites flamable objects that aren't being worn or carried.
Your skin color turns into a vibrant green.
You are deaf on one ear.
You lose your sense of taste.
One of your body parts becomes invisible.
Your eyes start to glow brightly.

monster.name: Black Slaad

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The slaad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). The slaad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The slaad can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The slaad's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The slaad regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the slaad fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} and not be able to regain hit points until the end of the slaad's next turn.

action.name: Tongue (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Chaos Spray (Slaad Form Only) {@recharge 5}
entries: The slaad exhales mucus in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 15d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Teleport
entries: As a bonus action, the slaad magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendaryHeader: The slaad can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The black slaad regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The slaad casts one spell.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The slaad uses its Teleport action.

legendary.name: Tongue
entries: The slaad makes a tongue attack.

variant.name: Control Gem
entries: Implanted in the slaad's brain is a magic control gem. The slaad must obey whoever possesses the gem and is immune to being {@condition charmed} while so controlled.

Certain spells can be used to acquire the gem. If the slaad fails its saving throw against {@spell imprisonment}, the spell can transfer the gem to the spellcaster's open hand, instead of imprisoning the slaad. A {@spell wish} spell, if cast in the slaad's presence, can be worded to acquire the gem.
A {@spell greater restoration} spell cast on the slaad destroys the gem without harming the slaad.

Someone who is proficient in Wisdom (Medicine) can remove the gem from an {@condition incapacitated} slaad. Each try requires 1 minute of uninterrupted work and a successful {@dc 20} Wisdom (Medicine) check. Each failed attempt deals 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage to the slaad.

action.name: Chaos Spittle (Slaad Form Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 40/80 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Temporal Echo (3/day)
entries: As a bonus action, the slaad can summon an echo of itself from the past or future. The echo has the same statistics as the slaad, but only 100 hit points, can't cast spells, can only make 1 attack, its claw attack doesn't stun targets and it can't summon more echos. The echo takes its turn immediately after the slaad's turn.
